body.p: We are excited to announce a new release for the Oxygen AI Positron Assistant! Version 0.9.2 comes with exciting new features like chat, preview changes, AI-based quick fixes, AI-based XPath extension functions, and new AI actions that allow grammar correction, rewrite content and to check how your content responds to specific questions.

The AI Positron Chat side view provides a better user experience and more control when invoking AI actions, allowing to see the response and preview its impact on the document using an action that triggers the visual XML-aware comparison. You may decide also to further refine the responses by continuing the discussion with the AI Positron platform in the chat view.

In a chat message you may use editor variables that expand to the selected content or the entire document, these allow to define flexible prompts and the support to save favorites enables you to store and easily reuse the prompts you find useful for your activity.
Along with the preview action for the AI responses, you may also choose the insert or copy to clipboard actions associated with each response.
Version 0.9.2 of the plugin improves the existing actions and contributes new AI actions, such as:

ul.li: Correct Grammar - Correct the grammar and spelling of the selected content.
Use Active Voice - Convert the selected content from passive voice to active voice.
Generate Questions - Find out possible questions that the selected content or the entire document responds to.
Answer Questions - See how AI will respond to your questions taking into account either the selected content or the entire document.

body.p: If an error message provides a good description of the identified problem and eventually a hint on how to fix it, which is typically the case with Schematron errors, then you may take advantage of the a quick-fix action called AI Positron Fix that tries to find a solution to that validation problem. This action can be triggered from the contextual menu for the validation problems that are displayed in the application Problems list.

The add-on now also contributes two XPath extension functions which can be used from XSLT stylesheets, XQuery scripts, and from Schematron schemas to process content or to perform validation checks on existing content. Custom XML refactoring operations based on XSLT or XQuery update can also take advantage of these AI functions, so you can apply also batch processing on multiple documents.

We want to remind you that we plan to frequently release new features and improvements, so please let us know what you think of the current version and stay tuned for exciting new versions of this plugin!
I understand your point about Q&A type of posts. I also noticed that you are interested in AI and how that impacts technical documentation, and that is why I asked Alin to get in touch with you.

I think we are in a very good position right now because the AI-generated content is not always suitable to be sent directly to end-users, but it is a good tool for writers who can then review and possibly edit the generated content further.

We had a basic initial release of the Oxygen AI Positron Assistant plugin before ConVEx (former DITA North America), and we presented it there in a test kitchen session that received a lot of interest and feedback. However, we made some very important changes in our latest release earlier this week to provide visual diff to allow writers to see what changed, moving from one-shot actions to actions that initiate a chat session, thus allowing users to fine-tune the result if needed. Users can also ask to process the document or the selection in the way that they want just by starting a new chat and using editor variables that expand to the document and selection, respectively, and be able to reuse those prompts by saving them as favorites.
